column1: 2 ^ Eructávit cor meum vèrbum bonum~; dico ego ópera mea regi. Lingŭa mea calamus scribaĕ velóciter scribèntis. ^ My heart hath uttered a good word~; I speak my works to the king. My tongue is the pen of a scrivener that writeth swiftly.

column2: diffúsa est gráția in lábiîs tuîs~; proptèrea benedíxit te Deus in aĕtèrnum. ^ Thou art beautiful above the sons of men
column3: grace is poured abroad in thy lips~; therefore hath God blessed thee for ever.

column1: 4 ^ Accìngere gládio tuo super femur tuum
column2: potentìssime. ^ Gird thy sword upon thy thigh

column1: 5 ^ Spècie tua et pulcritúdine tua intènde
column4: pròpter veritátem et mansuetúdinem et justìțiam
column5: et dedúcet te mirabìliter dèxtera tua. ^ With thy comeliness and thy beauty set out
column8: because of truth and meekness and justice
column9: and thy right hand shall conduct thee wonderfully.

column1: 6 ^ Sagìttaĕ tuaĕ acútaĕ~; pòpuli sub te cadent
column2: in corda inimicórum regis. ^ Thy arrows are sharp~; under thee shall people fall
column3: into the hearts of the king's enemies.
in sáĕculum sáĕculi~; vìrga direcțiónis vìrga regni tui. ^ Thy throne
column5: is forever and ever~; the sceptre of thy kingdom is a sceptre of uprightness.

column2: et odìsti iniqŭitátem~; proptèrea ûnxit te Deus
column3: Deus tuus óleo laĕtìțiaĕ praĕ consórtibus tuîs. ^ Thou hast loved justice
column6: hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

column1: 9 ^ Murra et gutta et cássia a vestimèntîs tuîs
column7: from these they have delighted thee~;

column1: 10 ^ fíliaĕ regum in honóre tuo~; ástitit regína a dèxtrîs tuîs in vestítu deaŭráto
column2: circùmdata varietáte. ^ the daughters of kings in thy glory~; the queen stood on thy right hand in gilded clothing

column5: et oblivíscere pòpulum tuum et domum patris tui. ^ Hearken
column9: and forget thy people and thy father's house.

column2: qŭóniam ìpse est Dòminus Deus tuus
column3: et adorábunt eum. ^ And the king shall greatly desire thy beauty
column4: for he is the Lord thy God

column1: 13 ^ Et fíliaĕ Tiri in munèribus vùltum tuum deprecabùntur~; òmnes dívites plebis. ^ And the daughters of Tyre hall entreat thy countenance with gifts~; all the rich among the people.
14 ^ Òmnis glória ejus fíliaĕ regis intrínsecus
column3: circumamìcta varietátibus. ^ All the glory of the daughter of the king is within

column1: 15 ^ Adducèntur regi vìrgines post eam~; pròximaĕ ejus afferèntur tìbi. ^ After her shall virgins be brought to the king~; her neighbours shall be brought to thee.
16 ^ Afferèntur in laĕtìția et exsultațióne~; adducèntur in templum regis. ^ They shall be brought with gladness and rejoicing~; they shall be brought into the temple of the king.
17 ^ Pro pátribus tuîs nati sunt tìbi fílii~; constìtues eos príncipes super òmnem terram. ^ Instead of thy fathers
column2: sons are born to thee~; thou shalt make them princes over all the earth.

column1: 18 ^ Mèmores èrunt nóminis tui in òmni generațióne et generațiónem. Proptèrea pòpuli confitebùntur tìbi in aĕtèrnum
column2: et in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ They shall remember thy name throughout all generations. Therefore shall people praise thee for ever
